intro: Potentilla fantolii, commonly known as the fantolii cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several oval-shaped leaflets, and it is known for its hardy nature. Due to its limited distribution, Potentilla fantolii is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
